text:
Hello content marketers!

Any tips on how to engage your list of newsletter subscribers? We used to have a 40% open rate on our newsletter, which has not dropped down to 25%. Trying to think of ways to re-activate the list of subscribers who used to open our emails…

text: Hi Smriti. I've written a piece about boosting email opens with <https://www.jeffbullas.com/user-generated-content-email-marketing/|user-generated content>, if that helps.

attachments.title: 6 Ways to Incorporate User-Generated Content in Email Campaigns
attachments.text: User-generated content is a great way to beef up email campaigns and to encourage more sales from customers.

text: Pricing a piece of content is pretty wild, given the variables involved.  I run a business that sells and subcontracts blog posts, so I'm pretty steeped in pricing content.

elements.text: Pricing a piece of content is pretty wild, given the variables involved.  I run a business that sells and subcontracts blog posts, so I'm pretty steeped in pricing content.

text: I recently wrote a blog post called something like "how much does a blog post cost," which I could scrounge up, if you're interested.

elements.text: I recently wrote a blog post called something like "how much does a blog post cost," which I could scrounge up, if you're interested.

text: One of the simplest, most ridiculously successful ways I've found to improve open rates is to include an interactive element in the email (especially quizzes, people LOVE quizzes). A subject or preview line with the word "Quiz:" will almost certainly improve open rates. (There are obviously other techniques with AB testing and user-gen content and such, but this is just a super easy and fun one.)

elements.text: One of the simplest, most ridiculously successful ways I've found to improve open rates is to include an interactive element in the email (especially quizzes, people LOVE quizzes). A subject or preview line with the word "Quiz:" will almost certainly improve open rates. (There are obviously other techniques with AB testing and user-gen content and such, but this is just a super easy and fun one.)

text: I went through my old emails for a doctor and after opening the email I got a text message. Little less familiar with SMS... What software would they use to deploy that? Twilio?

elements.text: I went through my old emails for a doctor and after opening the email I got a text message. Little less familiar with SMS... What software would they use to deploy that? Twilio?

text:
There are probably more than a few CRMs mixing in SMS messaging now, particularly for consumer-focused local businesses like that, but Autopilot was one of the earlier ones I saw that had it integrated with traditional email flows.

Example templates at <https://www.autopilothq.com/templates/use-cases/sms-marketing> .

I think there are now lots of vertical specific providers who will do it, too, eg a dental office website/CRM rollup app.

elements.text:
